intro: Reichardia tingitana subsp. discolor, commonly known as the Moroccan dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, dry habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Reichardia tingitana subsp. discolor is often found in coastal and mountainous regions of Morocco and Algeria.
